detailedDesc: Basically you want to paramaterize LayerRenderer with AbstractClientPlayer and all the functions in the same class will error. You need to do this for every class that errors with a similier error message. Keep in mind not every class will use the AbstractClientPlayer. Double check the entity type!
crashReport: The method addLayer(U) in the type RendererLivingEntity<AbstractClientPlayer> is not applicable for the arguments (LayerCape)
ocr: The method addLayer(U) in the type Render
The method addLayer(LI) in the type is not applicable for the arguments (LayerCape)

cmdDesc: javax.vecmath cannot be resolved to a type
detailedDesc: Looks like your missing VecMath library. Add the jar below to your project dependencies.
ocr: Matrix4f cannot be resolved to a type
javax.vecmath cannot be resolved to a type

detailedDesc: Looks like for some reason, the decompilier left in $ in the name of inner classes. This confused the JRE and JVM into looking for a inner class of a inner class. In order to fix it, just remove all the $ from the classes: "net.minecraft.client.renderer.EntityRenderer$1" and "net.minecraft.client.renderer.EntityRenderer$2", and new instances of those classes.

cmdDesc: default methods are not supported in -source 1.6
detailedDesc:
When runnign recompile.bat, it fails with this message: "error: default methods are not supported in -source 1.6"

In /conf/mcp.cfg, find
```
 CmdRecomp     = %s -Xlint:-options -deprecation -g -source 1.6 -target 1.6 -classpath "{classpath}" -sourcepath {sourcepath} -d {outpath} @{javasrc}
```
and replace it with
```
CmdRecomp     = %s -Xlint:-options -deprecation -g -source 1.8 -target 1.8 -classpath "{classpath}" -sourcepath {sourcepath} -d {outpath} @{javasrc}
```

The error could be one of two things. Double check your HTTP methods are returning actual correctly formatted JSON in your browser. 

The other issue it might be is GSON is converting a recursive object. If you are using GSON and trying to save the Minecraft.getMinecraft() object it will fail. Make sure its static if you don't want it to save, or turn on @Expose usage in the GSONBuilder class.

cmdDesc: MCP is running out of ram when decompiling
detailedDesc:
MCP is running out of ram when decompiling

Go to conf/mcp.cfg. Find this line
```
CmdFernflower = %s -jar %s -din=1 -rbr=0 -dgs=1 -asc=1 -log=WARN {indir} {outdir}
```and change it to this
```
CmdFernflower = %s -Xmx2G -jar %s -din=1 -rbr=0 -dgs=1 -asc=1 -log=WARN {indir} {outdir}
```
That should give MCP 2gb of ram when decompiling.

cmdDesc: HUDConfigScreen$MouseOverFinder cannot be cast to java.util.function.Predicate
detailedDesc:
Minecraft crashed with "HUDConfigScreen$MouseOverFinder cannot be cast to java.util.function.Predicate"

Looks like you have imported the wrong Predicate. Make sure you import __java.util.function.Predicate__ .
crashReport: $MouseOverFinder cannot be cast to class java.util.function.Predicate

detailedDesc: Hover over run, go to Run Configurations -> Arguments then remove the option '-Xincgc'.
ocr: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine

detailedDesc:
There are a few issues that could cause this. Outdated graphics card, or remote viewing through Remote Desktop connection. Here is a helpful article by the mojang team about this issue: https://minecrafthopper.net/help/pixel-format-not-accelerated/

You can also try downgrading your java to this version https://archive.org/details/jre-8u51-windows-x64 if you have a first or second generation intel graphics card

cmdDesc: Crashing when trying to view resource packs
detailedDesc: This one is on me. I forgot in Episode 21 to include this :neutral_face: . Make sure to include the pack.png in the root of your jar file! That should fix the crash.

This is a strange issue but it seems to be fixed by: casting ByteBuffer instances to Buffer before calling the method. Two fixes: ```Crashed on export:``` 1) Make sure you have Java Development Kit (JDK) for Java 8. 
2) Right click Client > Build path > Configure build path > Find your JRE > Edit > Installed JREs... 
3) Add > Standard VM > Select the JRE home and name 
```Crash inside of IDE: ``` Open Minecraft.java and find the readImageToBuffer method. Find the line that says `ByteBuffer bytebuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(4 * aint.length);`.  Before the ByteBuffer.allocate part, put `(ByteBuffer)`. For more detail (if your interested): https://github.com/apache/felix/pull/114 and https://www.google.com/search?q=java.lang.NoSuchMethodError:%20java.nio.ByteBuffer.flip()Ljava/nio/ByteBuffer;

Looks like your missing the optifine textures. You can either extract the textures from the jar yourself, or I have created this zip file. Extract it to "<mcp>/src/minecraft/assets/minecraft/textures", and refresh your project

cmdDesc: Please send your MCP log file
detailedDesc:
Can you please send your MCP.log file in this channel? It's located in <project>/logs/mcp.log . You will need to zip it up to send it over Discord. 

*__Currently the bot will not parse these, so please wait for a human to look at your file.__*
Looks like your using JDK %A1%. You need to be using JDK 8. You can download JDK 8 here: https://adoptopenjdk.net/?variant=openjdk8&jvmVariant=hotspot
Could you please upload your latest crash report located in **<mcp>/jars/crash-reports/** to this channel?
Try making the erroring variable textureObj final, see if that fixes your issue
ocr: Cannot refer to the non-final local variable
Cannot refer to the nan-final local variable

detailedDesc: You need to run Minecraft at least once before trying to decompile it
ocr: Please run launcher & Minecraft at least once

detailedDesc: Looks like your trying to call a function that doesn't exist. Double check you have either created this function, or that it is spelled correctly.
ocr: The method imtO is undefined for the type Client

detailedDesc: You can close the server project, you will not be needing it for this client tutorial series. To close it: right click Server -> Close project
Double check that your Minecraft has decompiled successfully, or could also be an issues with -Xincgc
ocr: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine

detailedDesc: Change your java Project to be recompiling with JDK 8 in your IDE
ocr: operator is not allowed for source level below 1.7
Lambda expressions are allowed only at source level 1.8 or above

detailedDesc: You have compile time errors in your code. Your client will not run until you fix these. Your IDE will tell you what these are in the error pane.
Looks like you did not shade in the Discord library from your libs folder. Make sure to shade in **every** library in your libs folder to your jar before running it outside of eclipse.
Looks like when your json was being parsed, it expected a certain type of number, but got a different type. Double check to make sure you have cleared any old JSON files before parsing them.
Looks like a method tried to parse non JSON data as JSON data. I would check to make sure the website you are requesting data from is actually returning JSON data.

Looks like Minecraft is trying to read a BufferedImage and it was not found. Make sure any BufferedImages (pack.png,  server-icon title-icon) are in your exported assets. I don't have the capability to tell you exactly which image it is as of now.
Looks like you are trying to register a null texture. I would add some print statements or breakpoints to figure out why your texture is null.
Looks like you are trying to access a value in a list at a index that is not valid. You can read about it more here https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/IndexOutOfBoundsException.html
Looks like the website you are trying to ping is offline. Double check its online and that you have the correct url
crashReport: Caused by: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect

cmdDesc: decompile.bat IndexError list index out of range
detailedDesc:
This is a very wacky error only a few people seem to be having. To fix this, open up decompile.py, and comment out: ```py
commands.checkupdates()```

 It should look like this: ```py
#commands.checkupdates()```

*Thanks to HqperNoob_#2647 for this solution!*
ocr: IndexError: list index out of range

detailedDesc: To fix this error, go to **Run Configurations** > **Run/Debug** > **Arguments** > Add `-Djava.library.path=versions/1.8.9/1.8.9-natives/` (Replace `1.8.9` with the Minecraft version you are using)
ocr: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no lwjgl64 in java.library.path

detailedDesc: Don't worry, this is not an error!
ocr: Scala files will not be recompiled

detailedDesc:
Looks like you are using Optifine for 1.8.9, and trying to use a Shaderpack.

Please download the attached document by Stealth, and mega12345mega. 

They both have spent some time trying to debug this issue, and write some instructions n how to fix it.

cmdDesc: Cartesian.java | cannot convert from List<Object> to List<T>
detailedDesc:
Sometimes when decompiling mcp, you encounter an error with Cartesian.java The solution to this is going to line 73 in Cartesian.java and changing the line from:
```java
return (Iterator<T[]>)(this.iterables.length <= 0 ? Collections.singletonList((Object[])Cartesian.createArray(this.clazz, 0)).iterator() : new Cartesian.Product.ProductIterator(this.clazz, this.iterables));
```
To:
```java
return (Iterator)(this.iterables.length <= 0 ? Collections.singletonList((Object[])Cartesian.createArray(this.clazz, 0)).iterator() : new Cartesian.Product.ProductIterator(this.clazz, this.iterables));
```
crashReport: Type mismatch: cannot convert from List<Object> to List<T>
